upperboundmethods

Class AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • upperboundmethods.AbstractUpperBoundEstimation
      • upperboundmethods.AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BermudanSwaptionValueEstimatorInterface

    public class AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation
extends AbstractUpperBoundEstimation
    Implements the Andersen-Broadie (2004) method of martingale approximation using sub-simulations.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Lennart Quante

      Constructors

      Creates an AndersenBroadieUpperBound estimator.
      AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation(int subsimulationPaths)
      Creates an AndersenBroadieUpperBound estimator with fixed SimpleLowerBoundEstimation as input, weight of martingale =1 and simplest exercise strategy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation

        public AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation(AbstractLowerBoundEstimationInputForUpperBound lowerBoundMethod,
                                           double weightOfMartingale,
                                           int pathsSubsimulationsStepA,
                                           int pathsSubsimulationsStepB,
                                           net.finmath.montecarlo.process.EulerSchemeFromProcessModel.Scheme subsimulationScheme)
        Creates an AndersenBroadieUpperBound estimator.
        Parameters:
        lowerBoundMethod - The lower bound method to be used as a basis for the upper bound.
        weightOfMartingale - The weighting scheme for point value approximation - 0 = lower bound, 1= upper bound, 0.5 = A-B point wise estimate.
        pathsSubsimulationsStepA - number of subsimulation Paths in case 2a of A-B algorithm, i.e. if exercise at current simulation time.
        pathsSubsimulationsStepB - number of subsimulation Paths in case 2b of A-B algorithm, i.e. if no exercise at current simulation time.
        subsimulationScheme - The discretization scheme to be used.

      • AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation

        public AndersenBroadieUpperBoundEstimation(int subsimulationPaths)
        Creates an AndersenBroadieUpperBound estimator with fixed SimpleLowerBoundEstimation as input, weight of martingale =1 and simplest exercise strategy.
        Parameters:
        subsimulationPaths - The number of paths to be used in both subsimulation possibilites

    • Method Detail

      • calculateMartingaleApproximation

        protected java.util.ArrayList<net.finmath.stochastic.RandomVariable> calculateMartingaleApproximation(int evaluationPeriod,
                                                                                                      net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel model,
                                                                                                      net.finmath.stochastic.RandomVariable[] cacheUnderlying,
                                                                                                      net.finmath.stochastic.RandomVariable[] cacheOptionValues,
                                                                                                      net.finmath.stochastic.RandomVariable[] triggerValues)
                                                                                               throws net.finmath.exception.CalculationException
        Calculates the martingale components based on parallelized subsimulation.
        Specified by:
        calculateMartingaleApproximation in class AbstractUpperBoundEstimation
        Parameters:
        evaluationPeriod - period of the evaluation time in the model time discretization
        model - the LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel to be used
        cacheUnderlying - The cached exercise values from the lower bound method.
        cacheOptionValues - The cached option values from the lower bound method.
        triggerValues - The cached trigger values from the lower bound method.
        Returns:
        The Monte Carlo estimate of the martingale component, as a double.
        Throws:
        net.finmath.exception.CalculationException - if calculation of some LIBOR fails

      • executeSubsimulation

        double[] executeSubsimulation(net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel model,
                              int path,
                              int optionPeriod,
                              int liborPeriod,
                              net.finmath.stochastic.RandomVariable[] triggerValues,
                              int numberOfOptionPeriods,
                              net.finmath.stochastic.RandomVariable[] cacheUnderlying)
                       throws net.finmath.exception.CalculationException
        Method for subsimulations to be called by parallelized execution interface
        Parameters:
        model - the LMM used
        path - path on which the subsimulation is performed
        optionPeriod - optionPeriod in which the subsimulation is performed
        liborPeriod - LIBOR period in which the subsimulation is performed
        triggerValues - trigger values from lower bound method
        numberOfOptionPeriods - number of periods of the option
        cacheUnderlying - cached exercise values from lower bound method
        Returns:
        The triple {discountedExerciseValue,discountedFutureExerciseValue,previousExerciseIndicator}
        Throws:
        net.finmath.exception.CalculationException - if some LIBOR rate calculation fails

      • createSubsimulationModelTerminating

        private net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel createSubsimulationModelTerminating(net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel model,
                                                                                                                    int startingPeriod,
                                                                                                                    int endPeriod,
                                                                                                                    int path,
                                                                                                                    int pathsOfSubsimulation)
                                                                                                             throws net.finmath.exception.CalculationException
        This method creates a new model with a changed starting and final date and initializes the LIBOR rates according to the given path of the input model.
        Parameters:
        model - LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel to be used.
        startingPeriod - Period when the new model should start.
        endPeriod - Period when the new model should stop (inclusive).
        path - Path of the original model to be used for starting values.
        pathsOfSubsimulation - Number of paths for the new model.
        Returns:
        The model to be used for subsimulations.
        Throws:
        net.finmath.exception.CalculationException - if some rate calculation fails

      • liborModelCreator

        private net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORMarketModel liborModelCreator(net.finmath.time.TimeDiscretization shortenedLiborDiscretization,
                                                                               net.finmath.marketdata.model.curves.ForwardCurve forwardCurve,
                                                                               net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORModelMonteCarloSimulationModel model)
                                                                        throws net.finmath.exception.CalculationException
        Help method to create a LIBORMarket model from the input parameters
        Parameters:
        shortenedLiborDiscretization - The models discretization (LIBOR and time)
        forwardCurve - The initial forward curve of the model
        model - The original model from which the model is derived
        Returns:
        A LIBORMarketmodel with fixed volatility and correlation.
        Throws:
        net.finmath.exception.CalculationException - if some stochastic driver calculation fails

        private double[][] createVolatilityMatrix(double a,
                                          double b,
                                          double c,
                                          net.finmath.marketdata.model.curves.ForwardCurve forwardCurve,
                                          net.finmath.time.TimeDiscretization shortenedLiborDiscretization)
        Creates a volatility matrix based on the rebonato instant volatility o_i = a+b*exp(-c*T_i)
        Parameters:
        a - parameter a for rebonato inst. volatility
        b - parameter b for rebonato inst. volatility
        c - parameter c for rebonato inst. volatility
        forwardCurve - The forward curve to be used
        shortenedLiborDiscretization - The time discretization to be used
        Returns:
        2dimensional volatility matrix

      • createForwardCurveFromRealization

        private net.finmath.marketdata.model.curves.ForwardCurve createForwardCurveFromRealization(net.finmath.stochastic.RandomVariable[] forwardCurveRandomVariable,
                                                                                           net.finmath.time.TimeDiscretization shortenedLiborDiscretization,
                                                                                           int path)
        Creates a forward curve from a RandomVariable, e.g. a LIBOR rate from a LMM.
        Parameters:
        forwardCurveRandomVariable - The input LIBOR rate RV
        shortenedLiborDiscretization - The discretization to be used
        path - The path of the random variable to be used
        Returns:
        The forward curve.
